meaningMnemonic: If you <kanji>become</kanji> aware of something to an <kanji>extent</kanji> you'll end up saying <vocabulary>I see</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>That's right</vocabulary>! But you won't see if you didn't become aware enough. So it's that extent of understanding you're trying to reach before you can chime in with an "Ahh, <vocabulary>indeed</vocabulary>."
readingMnemonic: The readings for this word are both kun'yomi readings. The reading for 成 is from 成る and it keeps the る part. It's just hidden in the kanji. If you can remember that, you'll know this reading!
